ast.name: Japanese Study
ast.comment:
Japanese Study Project

Summary:
This project is an attempt to create a learning tool that can be used by people who are interested or are currently studying the japanese language. It is intended to cover Hiragana, Katakana and the first 80 Kanji (first grade).

As well as providing study information, the app will also allow users to test their knowledge by identifying the japanese character that matches with the english translation.

Functional Expectations:
- Display menu system for users to navigate between study and testing
- Display all Hiragana Characters with english translation
- Display all Katakana Characters with english translation
- Display first 80 Kanji with their english translation
- When user clicks on Kanji in study mode, the program will switch to a more detailed view telling the user the specific details about the Kanji
- Each study mode will contain a quick 'test' button that will link to the study mode for the contents of that study scene only
- When using the test modes the program will select randomly from the study set and retrieve a value to display along with 4 different options for answers
- During the tests your score will be retained so you can determine how many you got right and wrong during the test

Tasks to be completed in future version:
- Test Modes for Hiragana(pg1, pg2), Katakana(pg1, pg2), Kanji
- Finish the menu navigation to link to test modes
- Create the Katakana Study sheet and link navigation
- Populate the rest of the Kanji list
- Create and link the rest of Large Kanji Details
- Create scoring system for test modes

Outsourced Content:
[Background Watermark]: http://www.asianartjewelry.org/wp-content/uploads/2013/03/Asian-Art-Jewelry-91.jpg

Navigation Logic
[Reference for the method LoadScene(Number) which works as a navigation controller for the UI in this program. You pass in the number corresponding to the scene you want to load, and it loads the rest. The following is the structure of the menu]

1. Main Menu
2. Study Menu
2.1 Hiragana Page 1(Study)
2.2 Hiragana Page 2(Study)
2.3 Katakana Page1 (Study)
2.4 Katakana Page2 (Study)
2.5 Kanji (Study)
2.5.1-2.5.80 Large Kanji Info Page
3. Test Menu
3.1 Test All Hiragana
3.1.1 Test Hiragana from Page1
3.1.2 Test Hiragana from Page2
3.2 Test All Katakana
3.2.1 Test Katakana from Page1
3.2.2 Test Katakana from Page2
3.3 Test All Kanji

body.text: Calls Load Scene and redirects to the main menu
Central Point of navigation operations, takes the index of the scene needed, decodes the information and loads the relevant scene
Add Home Button to current Scene
Adds Run Test Btn to current Scene
Adds Next Page Button to current Scene
Handles the population of the study sheets and their button layouts
Add Back Btn to current Scene
Loads and formats the pages that are menus
Loads in all the small Kanji boxes in the study mode and calculates their location
Loads the screens for the large details of the 80 Kanji
This Action will load the individual test screens, populate the test data and create the answer buttons. After the test is complete it will send the user to the CompleteTest Scene
This will display the number of correct answers that the user got during their test, then when they are finished it will take them back to the main menu
